Package com.krab.lazy

Class LazyGui

java.lang.Object
com.krab.lazy.LazyGui
public class LazyGui extends Object
Main class for controlling the GUI from a processing sketch. Should be initialized as a global variable in processing setup() function with new LazyGui(this). Registers itself at end of the draw() method and displays the GUI whenever draw() ends. Allows the library user to get the value of a gui control element at any time inside draw(), even repeatedly inside loops. If the control element does not exist yet at the time its value is requested it gets newly created just in time. Please note that only one LazyGui object is expected to exist in any given sketch, due to internal static classes.

  • Constructor Details

    • LazyGui

      public LazyGui(processing.core.PApplet sketch)
      Main constructor for the LazyGui object which acts as a central hub for all GUI related methods. Meant to be initialized once in setup() with new LazyGui(this). Registers itself at end of the draw() method and displays the GUI whenever draw() ends.
      Parameters:
      sketch - the sketch that uses this gui, should be 'this' from the calling side

    • LazyGui

      public LazyGui(processing.core.PApplet sketch, LazyGuiSettings settings)
      Constructor for the LazyGui object which acts as a central hub for all GUI related methods. Meant to be initialized once in setup() with new LazyGui(this). Registers itself at end of the draw() method and displays the GUI whenever draw() ends.
      Parameters:
      sketch - main processing sketch class to display the GUI on and use keyboard and mouse input from
      settings - settings to apply (loading a save on startup will overwrite them)
      See Also:
      • LazyGuiSettings

  • Method Details

    • getGuiCanvas

      public processing.core.PGraphics getGuiCanvas()
      Utility method for displaying the GUI before draw() ends for the purposes of recording. Does not update the gui, only returns the previous frame's gui canvas. Can be confusing when displayed due to seeing duplicated GUI images with slightly different content.
      Returns:
      previous frame's gui canvas

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Updates and draws the GUI on the main processing canvas. Gets called automatically at the end of draw(), Must stay public because otherwise this registering won't work: app.registerMethod("draw", this);
      See Also:
      • draw(PGraphics)

    • draw

      public void draw(processing.core.PGraphics targetCanvas)
      Updates and draws the GUI on the specified parameter canvas, assuming its size is identical to the main sketch size. Gets called automatically at the end of draw(). LazyGui will enforce itself being drawn only once per frame internally, which can be useful for including the gui in a recording. If it does get called manually, it will get drawn when requested and then skip its automatic execution for that frame.

      Resets any potential hint(DISABLE_DEPTH_TEST) to the default hint(ENABLE_DEPTH_TEST) when done, because it needs the DISABLE_DEPTH_TEST to draw the GUI over 3D scenes and has currently no way to save or query the original hint state.

      Parameters:
      targetCanvas - canvas to draw the GUI on

    • isMouseOutsideGui

      public boolean isMouseOutsideGui()
      Utility function to tell if the latest mouse event collided and interacted with the GUI. For example with a mouse controlled brush you might not want to keep drawing on the main canvas when you just want to adjust its properties in the GUI and you don't expect that to affect the artwork.
      Returns:
      whether you should use this mouse press in your processing sketch

    • slider

      public float slider(String path)
      Gets the value of a float slider control element. lazily initializes it if needed and uses a default value of 0.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      Returns:
      current float value of the slider

    • slider

      public float slider(String path, float defaultValue)
      Gets the value of a float slider control element. lazily initializes it if needed and uses a specified default value.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      defaultValue - default value to set the slider to
      Returns:
      current float value of the slider

    • slider

      public float slider(String path, float defaultValue, float min, float max)
      Gets the value of a float slider control element. lazily initializes it if needed and uses a default value specified in the parameter. along with enforcing a minimum and maximum of reachable values.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      defaultValue - the default value, ideally between min and max
      min - the value cannot go below this, min < max must be true
      max - the value cannot go above this, max > min must be true
      Returns:
      current float value of the slider

    • sliderSet

      public void sliderSet(String path, float value)
      Sets the value of a float slider control element manually at runtime without requiring user interaction. Does not block changing the value in the future in any way. Initializes a new float slider at the given path if needed with the value parameter used as a default value and with no constraint on min and max value.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      value - value to set the float slider at the path to

    • sliderAdd

      public void sliderAdd(String path, float amountToAdd)
      Adds a float to the value of a float or int slider control element manually at runtime without requiring user interaction. Does not block changing the value in the future in any way. Initializes a new float slider at the given path if needed with default value 0 and with no constraint on min and max value.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      amountToAdd - value to set the float slider at the path to

      Returns:

    • plotSet

      public void plotSet(String path, float xyz)
      Sets the vector value of a 2D grid control element with an extra z slider. Lazily initializes it if needed and sets each of its x,y,z values to the parameter default.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the plot control element
      xyz - value to set to each axis

    • plotSet

      public void plotSet(String path, float x, float y)
      Sets the vector value of a 2D control element. Lazily initializes it if needed and sets its x,y values to the parameter defaults. The extra z slider will not be shown if the plot is initialized in this way.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the plot control element
      x - x value to set
      y - y value to set

    • plotSet

      public void plotSet(String path, float x, float y, float z)
      Sets the vector value of a 2D grid control element with an extra z slider. Lazily initializes it if needed and sets each of its x,y,z values to the separate parameter defaults.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the plot control element
      x - x value to set
      y - y value to set
      z - z value to set

      Parameters:

      valueToSet - vector value to set

      public void toggleSet(String path, boolean value)

      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      value - current value of the toggle

    • button

      public boolean button(String path)
      Gets the value of a button control element and sets it to false. Lazily initializes the button if needed. Meant to be used inside draw() like this: 
       if(gui.button("actions/print")){
     println("hello world");
 }
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      Returns:
      button value that can only be true once per user interaction

    • radio

      public String radio(String path, List<String> options)
      Gets the currently selected string from a list of options in a gui control element. Lazily initializes the radio element if needed - any later changes in the options parameter will be ignored. Sets the default value to the first value in the list.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      options - list of options to display
      Returns:
      currently selected string

    • radio

      public String radio(String path, List<String> options, String defaultOption)
      Gets the currently selected string from a list of options in a gui control element. Lazily initializes the radio element if needed - any later changes in the options parameter will be ignored. Sets the default value to the specified parameter value, which must be contained in the options list, or it will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      options - list of options to display
      defaultOption - default option to select, which must also be found in the options, or it will be ignored
      Returns:
      currently selected string

    • radio

      public String radio(String path, String[] options)
      Gets the currently selected string from an array of options in a gui control element. Lazily initializes the radio element if needed - any later changes in the options parameter will be ignored. Sets the default value to the specified parameter value, which must be contained in the options array, or it will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      options - list of options to display
      Returns:
      currently selected string

    • radio

      public String radio(String path, String[] options, String defaultOption)
      Gets the currently selected string from an array of options in a gui control element. Lazily initializes the radio element if needed - any later changes in the options parameter will be ignored. Sets the default value to the specified parameter value, which must be contained in the options array, or it will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      options - list of options to display
      defaultOption - default option to select, must also be found in options, or it is ignored
      Returns:
      currently selected string

    • radioSet

      public void radioSet(String path, String optionToSet)
      Sets the radio element value to a given parameter. Does not lazily initialize the radio element because it doesn't know what all the options should be. If the option to set is not found in the radio's existing list of options - it is ignored and a warning message is printed to console.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      optionToSet - string option to set the radio element to

    • colorPicker

      public PickerColor colorPicker(String path)
      Gets the color value of a color picker control element. Lazily initializes the color picker if needed. Default hsba values are (1,1,0,1) - therefore default color is black.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      Returns:
      current hex and hsba values in a PickerColor object

    • colorPicker

      public PickerColor colorPicker(String path, float grayNorm)
      Gets the color value of a color picker control element. Lazily initializes the color picker if needed with the specified grayNorm brightness in the range [0,1]. Default hsba values are (0,0,grayNorm,1).
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      grayNorm - default brightness in the range [0,1]
      Returns:
      current hex and hsba values in a PickerColor object

    • colorPicker

      public PickerColor colorPicker(String path, float hueNorm, float saturationNorm, float brightnessNorm)
      Gets the color value of a color picker control element. Lazily initializes the color picker if needed with the specified defaults.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      hueNorm - default hue in the range [0,1]
      saturationNorm - default saturation in the range [0,1]
      brightnessNorm - default brightness in the range [0,1]
      Returns:
      current hex and hsba values in a PickerColor object

    • colorPicker

      public PickerColor colorPicker(String path, float hueNorm, float saturationNorm, float brightnessNorm, float alphaNorm)
      Gets the color value of a color picker control element. Lazily initializes the color picker if needed with the specified defaults.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      hueNorm - default hue in the range [0,1]
      saturationNorm - default saturation in the range [0,1]
      brightnessNorm - default brightness in the range [0,1]
      alphaNorm - default alpha in the range [0,1]
      Returns:
      current hex and hsba values in a PickerColor object

    • colorPicker

      public PickerColor colorPicker(String path, int hex)
      Gets the color value of a color picker control element. Lazily initializes the color picker if needed with the parameter hex value as default color.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      hex - hex color as an integer like 0xFF123456, also works with processing 'color' type
      Returns:
      hex and hsba values in a PickerColor object

    • colorPickerSet

      public void colorPickerSet(String path, int hex)
      Sets the color picker to a given hex value. Lazily initializes the color picker if needed with the parameter hex value as default color. Does not block changing the value in the future in any way.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      hex - hex color to set, also works with processing 'color' type

    • colorPickerHueAdd

      public void colorPickerHueAdd(String path, float hueToAdd)
      Adds hue to the color picker, looping it correctly in both directions at the [0,1] boundary. Lazily initializes the color picker if needed with default color 0xFF000000 (full alpha black). Does not block changing the value in the future in any way.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      hueToAdd - hue to add, with the hue value being normalized to the range [0,1]

    • hueModulo

      public static float hueModulo(float hue)
      Hue values loop at the 1 - 0 border both in the positive and negative direction, just like two pi loops back to 0.
      Parameters:
      hue - value to transfer to the [0-1] range without changing apparent color value
      Returns:
      hue in the range between 0-1

    • text

      public String text(String path)
      Gets the current value of a text input element. Lazily initializes the text input element if needed with its content set to an empty string.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      Returns:
      current value of a string input element

    • text

      public String text(String path, String content)
      Gets the current value of an editable text field element. Lazily initializes the string input if needed with the specified default.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      content - default value for the text content
      Returns:
      current value of a string input element

    • textSet

      public void textSet(String path, String content)
      Sets the current value of an editable text field element. Lazily initializes the text input element if needed and then sets its value to the specified content value. Setting it every frame will result in the text field effectively being read-only.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      content - default value for the text content

    • gradient

      public processing.core.PGraphics gradient(String path)
      Gets a gradient as an image with size matching the main processing sketch size. Lazily initializes the gradient picker if needed.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      Returns:
      PGraphics after endDraw() - ready to be displayed as an image

    • gradient

      public processing.core.PGraphics gradient(String path, int defaultHexColor)
      Gets a gradient as an image with size matching the main processing sketch size. Lazily initializes the gradient picker if needed and uses the same default color for every color stop.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      defaultHexColor - the same default color for 4 default color stops, useful for homogenous gradients
      Returns:
      PGraphics after endDraw() - ready to be displayed as an image

    • gradient

      public processing.core.PGraphics gradient(String path, int[] defaultColors)
      Gets a gradient as an image with size matching the main processing sketch size. Lazily initializes the gradient picker if needed with the alpha parameter as default alpha for all its colors.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      defaultColors - default color array for all the colors in the gradient if you're pasting colors in the format of #ef8e38 try replacing # with 0xFF
      Returns:
      PGraphics ready to be displayed as an image

    • gradientColorAt

      public PickerColor gradientColorAt(String path, float position)
      Gets a single color from a gradient at the specified position in the range [0, 1]. Lazily initializes the gradient picker if needed with autogenerated grayscale colors. Faster than get(x,y) by keeping a copy of the gradient in a 1D lookup table in memory.
      Parameters:
      path - forward slash separated unique path to the control element
      position - normalized position in the [0, 1] range you'd like to know the color of
      Returns:
      PickerColor color at the specified position in the gradient

    • pushFolder

      public void pushFolder(String folderName)
      Pushes a folder name to the global path prefix stack. Can be used multiple times in pairs just like pushMatrix and popMatrix(). Removes leading and trailing slashes to enforce consistency, but allows slashes to appear either escaped or anywhere else inside the string. Any GUI control element call will apply all the folders in the stack as a prefix to their own path parameter. This is useful for not repeating the whole path string every time you want to call a control element.
      Parameters:
      folderName - one folder's name to push to the stack
      See Also:
      • getFolder()

    • popFolder

      public void popFolder()
      Pops the last pushed folder name from the global path prefix stack. Can be used multiple times in pairs just like pushMatrix and popMatrix(). Warns once when the stack is empty and popFolder() is attempted. Any GUI control element call will apply all the folders in the stack as a prefix to their own path parameter. This is useful for not repeating the whole path string every time you want to call a control element.

    • clearFolder

      public void clearFolder()
      Clears the global path prefix stack, removing all its elements. Nothing will be prefixed in subsequent calls to control elements. Also happens every time draw() ends and LazyGui.draw() begins, in order for LazyGui to be certain of what the current path is for its own control elements like the options folder and so the library user doesn't have to pop all of their folders, since they get cleared every frame.

    • getFolder

      public String getFolder()
      Gets the current path prefix stack, inserting a forward slash after each folder name in the stack. Mostly used internally by LazyGui, but it can also be useful for debugging.
      Returns:
      entire path prefix stack concatenated to one string

    • hide

      public void hide(String path)
      Hide any chosen element or folder except the root window. Hides both the row and any affected opened windows under that node. The GUI then skips it while drawing, but still returns its values and allows interaction from code as if it was still visible. Can be called once in `setup()` or repeatedly every frame, the result is the same. Does not initialize a control and has no effect on controls that have not been initialized yet.
      Parameters:
      path - path to the control or folder being hidden - it will get prefixed by the current path prefix stack to get the full path

    • hideCurrentFolder

      public void hideCurrentFolder()
      Hides the folder at the current path prefix stack. See hide(String path)

    • show

      public void show(String path)
      Makes any control element or folder visible again if it has been hidden by the hide() function. Has no effect on visible elements. Does not reveal any windows except for those that were open and then hidden by the hide() function. Does not initialize a control and has no effect on controls that have not been initialized yet.
      Parameters:
      path - path to the control element or folder being hidden - it will get prefixed by the current path prefix stack to get the full path

    • showCurrentFolder

      public void showCurrentFolder()
      Shows the folder at the current path prefix stack. See show(String path)

    • getMainFont

      public processing.core.PFont getMainFont()
      Gets the main font as currently used by the GUI.
      Returns:
      main gui font

    • getSideFont

      public processing.core.PFont getSideFont()
      Gets the side font as currently used by the GUI.
      Returns:
      side gui font
